title: Alan Moore
summary: Alan Moore (born 18 November 1953) is an English writer known primarily for his work in comic books including Watchmen, V for Vendetta, The Ballad of Halo Jones, Swamp Thing, Batman: The Killing Joke and From Hell.[1] Regarded by many as the best comics writer in the English language,[2][3] he is widely recognized among his peers and critics. He has occasionally used such pseudonyms as Curt Vile,  Jill de Ray, Brilburn Logue, and Translucia Baboon; also, reprints of some of his work have been credited to The Original Writer when Moore requested that his name be removed.[4]
